mn28:0.2: The Longer Simile of the Elephant’s Footprint
mn28:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
mn28:2.1: “The footprints of all creatures that walk can fit inside an elephant’s footprint, so an elephant’s footprint is said to be the biggest of them all.
mn28:2.2: In the same way, all skillful qualities are included in the four noble truths.
mn28:2.4: The noble truths of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
mn28:3.1: And what is the noble truth of suffering?
mn28:3.2: Rebirth is suffering; old age is suffering; death is suffering; sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress are suffering; not getting what you wish for is suffering. In brief, the five grasping aggregates are suffering.
mn28:3.3: And what are the five grasping aggregates?
mn28:3.4: They are as follows: the grasping aggregates of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
mn28:4.1: And what is the grasping aggregate of form?
mn28:4.2: The four principal states, and form derived from the four principal states.
mn28:5.1: And what are the four principal states?
mn28:5.2: The elements of earth, water, fire, and air.
mn28:6.1: And what is the earth element?
mn28:6.2: The earth element may be interior or exterior.
mn28:6.3: And what is the interior earth element?
mn28:6.4: Anything internal, personal, that’s hard, solid, and appropriated. This includes:
mn28:6.5: head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces; or anything else internal, personal, that’s hard, solid, and appropriated.
mn28:6.6: This is called the interior earth element.
mn28:6.7: The interior earth element and the exterior earth element are just the earth element.
mn28:6.8: This should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
mn28:6.9: When you truly see with right understanding, you grow disillusioned with the earth element, detaching the mind from the earth element.
mn28:7.1: There comes a time when the exterior water element flares up.
mn28:7.2: At that time the exterior earth element vanishes.
mn28:7.3: So for all its great age, the earth element will be revealed as impermanent, liable to end, vanish, and perish.
mn28:7.4: What then of this ephemeral body appropriated by craving? Rather than ‘I’ or ‘mine’ or ‘I am’, they consider it to be none of these things.

mn28:8.2: ‘This painful feeling born of ear contact has arisen in me.
mn28:8.6: They see that contact, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are impermanent.
mn28:8.7: Based on that element alone, their mind leaps forth, gains confidence, settles down, and becomes decided.
mn28:9.1: Others might treat that mendicant with disliking, loathing, and detestation,
mn28:9.2: striking them with fists, stones, sticks, and swords.
mn28:9.4: ‘This body is such that fists, stones, sticks, and swords strike it.
mn28:9.5: But the Buddha has said in the Advice on the Simile of the Saw:
mn28:9.6: “Even if low-down bandits were to sever you limb from limb with a two-handed saw, anyone who had a malevolent thought on that account would not be following my instructions.”
mn28:9.7: My energy shall be roused up and unflagging, my mindfulness established and lucid, my body tranquil and undisturbed, and my mind immersed in samādhi and unified.
mn28:9.8: Gladly now, let fists, stones, sticks, and swords strike this body! For this is how the instructions of the Buddhas are followed.’

mn28:10.2: In that case they stir up a sense of urgency:
mn28:10.4: that while recollecting the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha in this way, equanimity based on the skillful does not become stabilized in me.’
mn28:10.5: They’re like a daughter-in-law who stirs up a sense of urgency when they see their father-in-law.
mn28:10.8: But if, while recollecting the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha in this way, equanimity based on the skillful does become stabilized in them, they’re happy with that.

mn28:11.1: And what is the water element?
mn28:11.2: The water element may be interior or exterior.
mn28:11.3: And what is the interior water element?
mn28:11.4: Anything internal, personal, that’s water, watery, and appropriated. This includes:
mn28:11.5: bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine; or anything else internal, personal, that’s water, watery, and appropriated.
mn28:11.6: This is called the interior water element.
mn28:11.7: The interior water element and the exterior water element are just the water element.
mn28:11.8: This should be truly seen with right understanding like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
mn28:11.9: When you truly see with right understanding, you grow disillusioned with the water element, detaching the mind from the water element.
mn28:12.1: There comes a time when the exterior water element flares up.
mn28:12.2: It sweeps away villages, towns, cities, countries, and regions.
mn28:12.3: There comes a time when the water in the ocean sinks down a hundred leagues, or two, three, four, five, six, up to seven hundred leagues.
mn28:12.4: There comes a time when the water in the ocean stands just seven palm trees deep, or six, five, four, three, two, or even just one palm tree deep.
mn28:12.5: There comes a time when the water in the ocean stands just seven fathoms deep, or six, five, four, three, two, or even just one fathom deep.
mn28:12.6: There comes a time when the water in the ocean stands just half a fathom deep, or waist deep, or knee deep, or even just ankle deep.
mn28:12.7: There comes a time when there’s not even enough water left in the great ocean to wet the tip of the toe.
mn28:12.8: So for all its great age, the water element will be revealed as impermanent, liable to end, vanish, and perish.

mn28:16.1: And what is the fire element?
mn28:16.2: The fire element may be interior or exterior.
mn28:16.3: And what is the interior fire element?
mn28:16.4: Anything internal, pertaining to an individual that’s fire, fiery, and appropriated. This includes:
mn28:16.5: that which warms, that which ages, that which heats you up when feverish, that which properly digests food and drink; or anything else internal, personal, that’s fire, fiery, and appropriated.

mn28:16.9: When you truly see with right understanding, you grow disillusioned with the fire element, detaching the mind from the fire element.

mn28:17.2: It burns up villages, towns, cities, countries, and regions until
mn28:17.3: it reaches a green field, a roadside, a cliff’s edge, a body of water, or cleared parkland, where it’s extinguished due to not being fed.
mn28:17.4: There comes a time when they go looking for a fire, taking just a chicken feather or a scrap of sinew as kindling.
mn28:17.5: So for all its great age, the fire element will be revealed as impermanent, liable to end, vanish, and perish.
